snippet.title: Celebrities who believe in UFOs, aliens and Bigfoot: Hollywood's most out there beliefs
snippet.content:
Celebs say the darndest things. Picture: Getty Images; istock
Fox News
Share
WE all love to speculate the existance of the supernatural and hey, while some of us believe we've seen a ghost or a UFO - thankfully we don't all have a worldwide platform we can share such wacky theories. While singer Kesha believes she has sex with ghosts, Kanye West doesn't just believe in God - he believes he IS God. Click through the gallery below for an insight into the most out there theories in Hollywood:
photo galleryWeirdest beliefs of Hollywood stars
Singer Kesha says she has sex with ghosts. "I've got a song called 'Supernatural', that song was about having sex with a ghost," she told Ryan Seacrest. "I lived in this flop house at Rural Canyon and there was this weird energy that lived there, and it used to keep me [up] at night and wake me up. And it progressed into this dark, sexual spirit." Picture: Getty Images1 of 20
"I am a god," West sings on his new album. "I wrote 'I Am a God'... Cause it's like, 'Yo! Nobody can tell me where I can and can't go'," he told W Magazine. "Man, I'm the number living and breathing rock star. I am Axl Rose; I am Jim Morrison; I am Jimi Hendrix." Tell us how you really feel, Kanye. Picture: Getty Images2 of 20
Kylie Jenner is another celebrity that believes in the chemtrails conspiracy theory. The 17-year-old shared her thoughts in a picture posted to her Twitter account. Picture: Getty Images; Twitter3 of 20
Dean Cain didn't believe in Bigfoot before he started filming the upcoming reality show "10 Million Dollar Bigfoot Bounty," but now his views have changed. "Since I've already shot the show, I can't say definitively whether I believe there's a Sasquatch, Bigfoot, Yeti out there," Cain said on "Fox Friends. Picture: Getty Images4 of 20
The country singer told Us Weekly that she has a "very irrational fear of spiders. And alien abductions." Musgraves also claimed she's seen "several UFOs." Picture: Getty Images5 of 20
Tom Delonge (left) from US band Blink-182 believes he had an encounter with an alien while filming near Area 51. He opened up to Paper magazine claiming the government once tapped his phone to find out about the information he had gathered on extraterrestrials.6 of 20
Actor Rob Lowe claims to be able to speak with dead people. "There's a device they use that the theory is it can translate.. that the spirits can talk through this device, for a lack of a better term.. I don't want to seem like a nut. I don't want to end my career here." Picture: Getty Images7 of 20
Pop star Lady Gaga once said she tries to refrain from having sex because she believes her partners will try and take "my creativity from me through my vagina." Picture: Getty Images8 of 20
Rocker Pete Doherty has been quoted saying the west wing of his home is haunted. He claims the area, which used to be the servants quarters of the house, will become lively as if ghosts are having a "mad party." Picture: Getty Images9 of 20
Angelina Jolie was once known for wearing a vial of blood around her neck, belonging to her then-husband Billy Bob Thorton. Not to worry, Thorton sported a vial of Jolie's blood around his neck too. It is rumored the two believed the vials strengthened their bond. Picture: Getty Images10 of 20
Coco Austin: The reality star has a ghostly admirer. Literally. Celebrity psychic Kim Russo told FOX411 Ice-T's wife came to her when she was being haunted by a ghost. "[Coco] had a ghost that was physically into her, that's not your typical," Russo recalled.11 of 20
Fran Drescher reportedly thinks she and her ex-husband were abducted by aliens and implanted with electronic tracking chips. She has spoken about matching scars the two have, noting the marks are from their alien encounters. Picture: Getty Images12 of 20
Claudia Schiffer recently gave a tour of her haunted Tudor mansion in England to Architectural Digest. However, the supermodel insisted her ghostly neighbors are really, really friendly. "We had a medium go around, and she told us that actually all the ghosts in the house are lovely. No one needs to be scared." Picture: Getty Images13 of 20
Michelle Pfeiffer recently revealed that she was in a cult when she first began her Hollywood career. For a time, she believed that humans could exist on sunlight alone. Picture: Getty Images14 of 20
Smoldering actress Megan Fox has said she believes in everything from leprechauns to Bigfoot to the Loch Ness Monster. "I believe that this stuff came from somewhere other than people's imaginations," she said. Picture: Getty Images15 of 20
"Gladiator" actor Russell Crowe claimed via Twitter to have recorded UFOs flying over Sydney's Royal Botanic Gardens. He even posted a video of the supposed UFO sighting, arguing with viewers on YouTube who said his UFO was a fake. Picture: Getty Images16 of 20
Hayden Panettiere is the latest to celebrity to share their thoughts on the chemical chemtrails conspiracy theory. She tweeted, "What the heck r they spraying over us?! It's been happening for years but only this extreme for the past few months." Picture: Getty Images17 of 20
Evan Rachel Wood doesn't go anywhere without carrying sage and the gemstone tiger's eye. Why? To clean "demons out of places." The 29-year-old "Westworld" star revealed her strange habit to Cosmopolitan magazine. Picture: Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images18 of 20
Shirley MacLaine's daughter claims her famous mom believed that daughter's father, Steve, was not her real father but a clone of the real one, an astronaut named Paul. For years Steve conned MacLaine into paying him up to $60,000 a month for "Paul's space travel expenses." Picture: Getty Images19 of 20
"This was probably eight years ago, I was in my backyard in LA. I looked up in the sky and there was three flying saucers," he told "This Morning's" Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. "I looked at my friend and said, 'Are you seeing this or am I losing my mind?' Picture: Getty Images20 of 20
Singer Kesha says she has sex with ghosts. "I've got a song called 'Supernatural', that song was about having sex with a ghost," she told Ryan Seacrest. "I lived in this flop house at Rural Canyon and there was this weird energy that lived there, and it used to keep me [up] at night and wake me up. And it progressed into this dark, sexual spirit." Picture: Getty Images "I am a god," West sings on his new album. "I wrote 'I Am a God'... Cause it's like, 'Yo! Nobody can tell me where I can and can't go'," he told W Magazine. "Man, I'm the number living and breathing rock star. I am Axl Rose; I am Jim Morrison; I am Jimi Hendrix." Tell us how you really feel, Kanye. Picture: Getty Images Kylie Jenner is another celebrity that believes in the chemtrails conspiracy theory. The 17-year-old shared her thoughts in a picture posted to her Twitter account. Picture: Getty Images; Twitter Dean Cain didn't believe in Bigfoot before he started filming the upcoming reality show "10 Million Dollar Bigfoot Bounty," but now his views have changed. "Since I've already shot the show, I can't say definitively whether I believe there's a Sasquatch, Bigfoot, Yeti out there," Cain said on "Fox Friends. Picture: Getty Images The country singer told Us Weekly that she has a "very irrational fear of spiders. And alien abductions." Musgraves also claimed she's seen "several UFOs." Picture: Getty Images Tom Delonge (left) from US band Blink-182 believes he had an encounter with an alien while filming near Area 51. He opened up to Paper magazine claiming the government once tapped his phone to find out about the information he had gathered on extraterrestrials. Actor Rob Lowe claims to be able to speak with dead people. "There's a device they use that the theory is it can translate.. that the spirits can talk through this device, for a lack of a better term.. I don't want to seem like a nut. I don't want to end my career here." Picture: Getty Images Pop star Lady Gaga once said she tries to refrain from having sex because she believes her partners will try and take "my creativity from me through my vagina." Picture: Getty Images Rocker Pete Doherty has been quoted saying the west wing of his home is haunted. I looked up in the sky and there was three flying saucers," he told "This Morning's" Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. 1 of 20
